#1 String: Face à cette situation, le rapport adopté par le Parlement doit clairement indiquer la nécessité de prendre des mesures pour lutter contre la pauvreté relative et le chômage.  Des mesures telles que: l'   utilisation appropriée des Fonds structurels, qui sont souvent mal utilisés, avec des politiques d'État centralisées;   la modernisation des télécommunications et des communications, notamment en intégrant les territoires les moins avancés dans les réseaux transeuropéens de chemins de fer d'ici à 2007;   le respect et le développement des ressources et des capacités agricoles et de pêche de ces pays, souvent attaqués par les propres politiques d'une Union européenne peu sensible;  promotion de politiques actives de création d'emplois, de préférence pour les femmes et les jeunes.
#2 String: Given this situation, the report adopted by the Parliament must clearly indicate the need for measures to combat relative poverty and unemployment. Measures such as: the appropriate use of the Structural Funds, which are often poorly employed, with centralized state policies; the modernization of telecommunications and communications, especially by integrating the least developed territories into the trans-European networks of railways by 2007; the respect and development of the resources and the agricultural and fishing capacities of these countries, often attacked by the own policies of an insensitive European Union; promotion of active job creation policies, preferably for women and young people.

#1 String: In conclusion, I would like to say what I expect from this reform: fair competition and the same conditions of competition for all, legal certainty for all companies, uniform application of competition policy, simplification of procedures in accordance with the principle of the stop shop , the coordination of the national authorities which, in my opinion, should be independent, the close cooperation of the authorities and the national courts with the Commission and a clear division of powers between the authorities and the national courts for the application of European competition law and agreements. On behalf of the Commission, I hope that it will focus on the essentials in fulfilling its role as the main guardian of European competition policies.
#2 String: In conclusion, I would like to say what I expect from this reform: fair competition and the same conditions of competition for all, legal certainty for all companies, uniform application of competition policy, simplification of procedures in line with the principle of the one-stop shop, the coordination of the national authorities which I consider should be independent, the close cooperation of the national authorities and courts with the Commission and a clear division of powers between the authorities and the national courts in applying the European competition law and cartels. From the Commission, I expect it to concentrate on the essentials by carrying out its tasks as the main guardian of European competition policies.
